name: F1 Smokehouse
why: Upscale BBQ with smoked prime rib and truffle potato salad in a rustic setting.
description: F1 Smokehouse is a polished spot bringing a modern twist to traditional Texas barbecue. Known for their slow-smoked meats and sides with a gourmet flair.

reviews.summary: A rave review from Fort Worth Weekly, highlighting the smoky depth of F1's prime rib.

name: Fred's Texas Cafe
address: 7101 Camp Bowie West Blvd, Fort Worth, TX 76116
why: A Fort Worth icon since 1978â€”huge burgers and chicken-fried steak in a laid-back vibe.
description: Fred's is beloved for its down-home atmosphere, cold beer, and killer burgers. A must-visit for both locals and tourists looking for authentic Texas grub.

reviews.summary: Featured on Food Network for its legendary burgers and laid-back Texas charm.

name: Fixe Southern House
why: Southern comfort with biscuits and shrimp 'n' grits in a chic, modern space.
description: Fixe delivers upscale Southern cooking in a refined setting, with highlights like buttermilk biscuits and fried chicken that put it on the foodie map.

reviews.summary: FWTX praises Fixe for elevating Southern fare while preserving comfort and hospitality.

name: Flying Fish
why: Casual Southern seafood chain serving catfish, shrimp, and po'boys with a fun, family vibe.
description: Flying Fish reels in fans with its relaxed atmosphere and fried seafood baskets. Great for a quick, satisfying fish fix.

name: Fuego Burger
why: Hidden gem known for fiery flavor and Latin-inspired burgers in a humble setting.
description: This no-frills burger joint impresses with bold flavors and juicy patties. A local favorite for adventurous burger lovers.
